oai_dc:dc.dc:title: NUMERICAL INVESTIGATION OF PRESSURE ACTING ON FLOATING PANEL FOR WAVE OVERTOPPING REDUCTION UNDER REGULAR WAVE ACTION
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Kawasaki, Koji
Dinh, Han Ut
Matsuno, Tetsuya
Fukumoto, Tadashi
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Multiphase flow model
solid-gas-liquid interaction
pressure
floating panel
wave overtopping reduction
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In this paper, a 3-D multiphase flow model with solid-gas-liquid interaction, named 'DOLPHIN-3D', is utilized to numerically investigate the characteristics of pressure acting on a floating panel, which is installed in front of an upright seawall for wave overtopping reduction. The validity and utility of the model were confirmed through good agreements between the numerical results and experimental ones in terms of the dynamic response of the floating panel and the pressure at the bottom of the panel. The numerical results revealed that the model can appropriately simulate the pressure acting on the floating panel as well as the dynamic behavior of the panel under wave action.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 33 (2012): Proceedings of 33rd Conference on Coastal Engineering, Santander, Spain, 2012; structures.82
